quotes.quote: The hum of bees is the voice of the garden.
The flower doesn't dream of the bee. It blossoms and the bee comes.
The keeping of bees is like the direction of sunbeams.
Every epigram should resemble a bee; it should have sting, honey, and brevity.

The men of experiment are like the ant, they only collect and use; the reasoners resemble spiders, who make cobwebs out of their own substance. But the bee takes the middle course: it gathers its material from the flowers of the garden and field, but transforms and digests it by a power of its own.
The bee is more honored than other animals, not because she labors, but because she labors for others.
Even bees, the little alsmen of spring bowers, know there is richest juice in poison-flowers.
The busy bee has no time for sorrow.
Bees that have honey in their mouths have stings in their tails.
The bee and the serpent often sip from the selfsame flower.
Everything takes time. Bees have to move very fast to stay still.
If bees only gathered nectar from perfect flowers, they wouldn’t be able to make even a single drop of honey.
Float like a butterfly, sting like a bee-- his hands can’t hit what his eyes can’t see.
When the flower blossoms, the bee will come.
The bee collects honey from flowers in such a way as to do the least damage or destruction to them, and he leaves them whole, undamaged and fresh, just as he found them.
A bee is never as busy as it seems; it's just that it can't buzz any slower.
That which is not good for the bee-hive cannot be good for the bees.
We think we can make honey without sharing in the fate of bees, but we are in truth nothing but poor bees, destined to accomplish our task and then die.
The little bee returns with evening's gloom, to join her comrades in the braided hive, there, housed beside their might honey-comb, they dream their polity shall long survive.
Bee stings are very educational .
It takes a bee to get the honey out.
The bee fertilizes the flower it robs.
The bee's life is like a magic well: the more you draw from it, the more it fills with water.
As a bee without harming the flower, its colour or scent, flies away, collecting only the honey, even so should the sage wander in the village.
Don't wear perfume in the garden — unless you want to be pollinated by bees.
When the bee comes to your house, let her have beer; you may want to visit the bee's house some day.
The bee is domesticated but not tamed.
Bees are the batteries of orchards, gardens, guard them.
Bees have so much to offer us if we only listen.
For to the bee a flower is the fountain of life, and to the flower a bee is the messenger of love.
If the bee disappeared off the face of the earth, man would only have four years left to live.
She liked to tell everybody that women made the best beekeepers, 'cause they have a special ability built into them to love creatures that sting. It comes from years of loving children and husbands.
